title: How to Find and Unhide Tagged Photos on Instagram

steps.title: Go to the profile of the person who posted the photo.
steps.content: Go to the profile of the person who posted the photo. If you hid a photo you're tagged in from your profile, you can unhide it by changing its tag options on the original poster's profile. [1] X Research source If you untagged yourself from the photo, you can't restore it to your profile. You'll need to contact the person who tagged you in the photo to ask that they tag you again.

steps.title: Scroll down until you find the photo.
steps.content: Scroll down until you find the photo. The only way to restore a hidden photo you were tagged in is to find the original post. But if the person who posted it has a lot of posts and you're worried you'll be scrolling for years, we have ideas for finding it quickly: [2] X Research source If you remember a hashtag or keyword that person added to the post's description, you can search for it . If you liked or commented on the photo, it'll be easiest to find it in your activity log: Tap your profile photo at the bottom-right corner of Instagram. Tap the three lines at the top. Tap Your activity . Tap Interactions . Tap either Comments or Likes (whichever type of interaction you had with the post you were tagged in). Tap Sort & filter . Enter a Start date and End date to show only posts from a particular time period. Once you find the photo, tap it to open it.

steps.title: Tap the icon with three dots ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the icon with three dots ⋮ . It’s in the upper-right corner of the photo. A menu will expand. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Tag Options.
steps.content: Tap Tag Options . It’s on the menu that appears when you tap the icon with three dots. It'll be the last option. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Show on my profile.
steps.content: Tap Show on my profile . This returns the photo to the Photos of You section of your Instagram profile. [5] X Research source Now you can tap the icon of a tag with a person inside on your profile to view all of your tagged photos, including the one you just unhid.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon in Instagram.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon in Instagram. You'll see it at the bottom-right corner. If you were tagged in a photo and didn't get a chance to approve it before the notification went away, we'll show you how to add that photo to your profile.

steps.title: Tap the icon with three ☰.
steps.content: Tap the icon with three ☰ . It’s in the upper-right corner of your Instagram profile page. This opens the menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Tags and mentions.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Tags and mentions . It’s below the header that says “How others can interact with you.” If you are using a web browser on a computer, you will need to tap Settings first.

steps.title: Ensure “Manually approve tags” is turned on.
steps.content: Ensure “Manually approve tags” is turned on. There is a toggle switch next to this option. When this option is turned on, you will need to review and approve tags for them to appear on your profile.

steps.title: Tap Review tags.
steps.content: Tap Review tags . It’s below the “Manually approve tags” toggle switch. This displays your pending tags that haven’t been approved. [7] X Research source Alternatively, you will get a notification when you are tagged in a post. You can view posts you’ve been tagged in your notifications, which is the heart icon in the upper-right corner of Instagram.

steps.title: Tap the three dots on the photo you want on your profile ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three dots on the photo you want on your profile ⋮ . You'll see these dots at the top-right corner of the photo.

steps.title: Tap Tag Options.
steps.content: Tap Tag Options . Another menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap Show In My Profile.
steps.content: Tap Show In My Profile . This photo will now appear in the Photos of You section. Now you can tap the icon of a tag with a person inside on your profile to view all of your tagged photos, including the one you just approved.
